intro: Cephaelis crebrinervia, commonly known as the narrow-veined cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves with prominent veins. It produces clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
